title: How did Italian culture change during the Renaissance? - Quora

response.answer_text: Within that time, it was a more significant change in the way they were thinking rather than the way they were living. Renaissance opened many closed doors which were seemed impossible or taboo to open by the Catholic Church.  In fact, people enjoyed a sense of curiosity to experience everything that they had been banned before. They found themselves more capable and stronger in order to change their environment and also their own lives. According to that, step by step, people got familiar with the other cultures from the ancient Greece to the Ottomans', Egypt's and so on. They also expanded their business with these cultures too. The more client for your product, the more product you produce; it means that in some cities like Venice and Florence, primary, and little production of goods expanded.  Architecture was enhanced a lot, which helped the cities to grow and expand in order to form a modern-like lives for the inhabitants. People played and enjoyed music more than before, and their surrounding were decorated more by the artists with more informal paintings, frescoes, sculptures, and etc which related to love and this-world stories.   Renaissance, to sum up, made Italian people exit from their pre-renaissance form of living, and introduced a style which was more or less a primary form of living we are experiencing now, a naive version of modern style.
